website_summaries.verdict: If someone in your household prefers a 12-cup pot of coffee and another just needs a single strong cup, this premium customizable Keurig will keep everyone happy.
pros: Use both K-Cup pods and ground coffee
Easily brew one cup or an entire carafe
Strong Brew feature brews a more intense single serving

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love Keurig coffee and the single serve is as good as ever. The carafe is extremely disappointing. It is virtually impossible to pour from the pot without coffee running all over the counter. It seems that this is one of the more basic design issues and it is inexcusable. Additionally, it seems hard to maintain a consistent quality of coffee from pot to pot. The $80 pot that I replaced did a much better job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, dribbly coffee brewer.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker does a great job of making beverages. It also does a great job of dribbling coffee on my counter and floor from the supplied glass carafe. Seems like a company with such a good reputation would be able to design a coffee maker that would be neater to use. We primarily use the glass carafe for everyday use and the single brewer for evening pleasures. I guess they put all their research into single serving brewers and have not worked so hard on the normal coffee maker part. If I had to do it again, I wouldn't buy this model.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Hux

customer_reviews.title: Drips!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good concept. However it drips coffee every time you pour. Makes a puddle.
customer_reviews.author: Genia

customer_reviews.title: beware
customer_reviews.text: Never brews a full pot, , single cup side works great, carafe side only works part of the time, very frustrating, we have had Keurig's for years with no issues, this one changed my mine about Keurig, read the reviews, mostly negative, with the same issues as me, company does nothing to help, refers you to their FAQ sections on their website,, which don't even show the Keurig duo. VERY DISSATIFIED.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Same ounces of coffee I made in my old Kuerig, comes out weak in this one. Tried making 3 cups. 10 oz. Regular brew and the strong brew. Tried 8 oz on regular brew. The “strong” button doesn’t stay on. The auto feature for the carafe only comes on if you power the machine on. Doesn’t come on automatically. The clock is on top of the unit so you can’t see it unless you’re standing right at it. Doesn’t keep your cup settings either. You have to choose them every time. First Kuerig I’ve ever been dissatisfied with. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wilson

customer_reviews.title: sad
customer_reviews.text: After brewing 5 carats of coffee it stopped working, now just the pod side works. Makes me my feelings hurt on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: WPC

customer_reviews.title: Carafe is a drippy mess.
customer_reviews.text: You would expect that the designers at Keurig could create a carafe that would not drip every time you pour yourself a cup of coffee. If a $15 Mr. Coffee can do it, why can’t my $160 Keurig? If you want to use an entire roll of paper towels every time you brew a pot of coffee - this product is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin S

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I have received. First one didn’t work at all, both sides, no matter what I did. Second one looked like it was used, scratches all over & big one on warming plate. This one came good, got it Nov 23, today, Dec 3, 10 days, the warming plate surface is starting to come off. I have only used a soft sponge to clean it! I’m so disappointed in Keurig. I so wanted this to be good because the concept is great. 🤦🏻‍♀️ For the money it’s not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I LOVED my Keurig machine. I wanted to make a pot of coffee for my guests and be able to offer a personal flavor of coffee to another guest with the kcup. After the first week the h/m button quit working. It is hard to set a auto pot to go off if the correct time does not work. Very disappointed and wish I could get a refund. I would not recommend this to anyone. I also told my daughter not to purchase because she was considering.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Quit after three weeks !
customer_reviews.text: Tried to send back to Amazon , would not take back ! this product has a lot of bad reviews ,,quit working after three weeks !!! out $160.00 !
customer_reviews.author: Ronald e viles

customer_reviews.title: over fill
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 10/23/19, worked great until a week ago. Now when 8 ounce button is pushed it dispenses 14 ounces. Will try to contact Keurig about the problem and will update review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: John Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: love that I can make a pot of coffee, and, a single cup.
customer_reviews.author: jkmole

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying my dual purpose Keurig
customer_reviews.text: The footprint is a little big, but I have ample space on my coffee bar to accommodate. Single serve is great and I enjoy the strong brew option. Brewing in the carafe is easy but there is no strong brew option when using the carafe. You can use more coffee to make up for this, but I would prefer the strong brew option when using the carafe. I bought the gold wire coffee basket, it's not included, instead of using filters. Since I have a cabinet partially over the top of the unit, it makes adding water a little cumbersome but not really difficult. Overall I'm enjoying the unit....let's see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing:(
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this coffee maker. It is cheaply made, when brewing a pot of coffee, I had to put the grounds around the sides because somehow the middle didnt get any water...which made the coffee very weak. It's doesn't seem very sturdy like my regular keurig, like one wrong move and I may break it. One last thing, I can't make a 4 cup pot of coffee, smallest pot is 6 cups. Im sending back today.
customer_reviews.author: Trina Ann

customer_reviews.title: 3rd time not a charm
customer_reviews.text: Hoping 3rd time was a charm but not the case. I gave this unit a 3rd try but had same problem as last 2. The timer turned on but took 45 minutes to brew only 10 cups when set for 12. Heating plate not only didn’t turn on but whole unit shut off completely. I love Keurig but they need to work out the kinks.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Padelford

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for people who like different types of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I bought this coffee maker. Now I can make a pot of coffee for me while my husband can make a single cup with pod. We like different types of coffee and this is perfect for us!!
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Hatlestad

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Wonder how to get refund now. Two from Amazon, third directly from keurig, now it quit working like the other two after 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff E.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Design
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these as I replaced the first one after one week. Returned the second one after 3 weeks. The pod side works fine. The carafe side is a horror story. Worked fine at first but then started shutting down around the 9 cup mark every time. The support person told me it was because I only used 10 tbsp of coffee rather than 15! Really? The carafe started staining and could not be cleaned though we used the same Folgers coffee we always used.... I am going to give it a rest and then try the Cuisinart version...
customer_reviews.author: Rob Harper

customer_reviews.title: Glass Coffee Pot
customer_reviews.text: Be Very carefull ----Glass at neck of pot is very thin ---my wife was pouring a cupof coffee froma fresh brewed pot ----the neck of the coffee pot broke almost scalding her with hot coffee. Glass isn't much thicker than light bulb glass ---don't know if it was a defect in the glass or if it is made to those specs, I am also calling Keurig to inform them of problem.
customer_reviews.author: katman

customer_reviews.title: WORSE COFFEE EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is the worse coffee pot I have ever used. I have to change the water each time I use it. It tastes like plastic gunk. I have NOT had a cup of coffee since I got it. I have wasted so many pods, (they are Keurig coffee pods). The coffee that I loved tastes like crap. I hate this machine.
customer_reviews.author: darlene

customer_reviews.title: Dispensing water improperly
customer_reviews.text: We have had the coffee maker for 3 weeks and it just started overflowing when we use the K-cup side. I measured the output and when I press 8 ounces I am getting 10 +. The craft also is not correct. Problems happen, but when I called Keurig they said that they would replace it. However, it is out of stock and we have to wait. I think I made a mistake getting it from Amazon. I paid $150.00 and now have a defective coffee maker until Keurig restocks. I should have bought a $125.00 Ninja at Sams. At least if that didn't work I could take it back and get one that did work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product but do not expect to wake up to coffee
customer_reviews.text: What? No timer? I like to get up to coffee! Otherwise all is good -very compact since prior I had two machines to do this! Yes a little disappointing that you forced me to buy a basket since the unit is a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Tinna Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. Don’t think it will last that long. Single cup brewing side splatters outside the perimeters of the cup. Thought I’d lose the handle to the coffee pot when cleaning. Having the water dispenser in the back of the unit is not easy to maneuver the entire machine in order to put the water in or to remove the water dispenser in order to pour out the unused water.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Firschein

customer_reviews.title: BE VERY CAREFUL
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows a different model then what you what you receive. You get the cheaper model. The one you can get at Walmart for $79.00. The top does not have any LCD or gauges like the picture shows. Very disappointed. I received this product when I was going thru something in my life and would have sent it back immediately but I had priorities and coffee was one of them so I just kept it BUT buyer beware.....Don't make the mistake I made.
customer_reviews.author: George V. Trager

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas 2019 and it’s September 1 2020 and it’s already not working properly. Everyday it’s something different!!!! Won’t brew the proper amount of cups, you set it for 10 cups and it brews 4. The warming brewer won’t stay on for 2 hours. It also from time to time decides to brew one “drip” at a time. It takes forever for the carafe to fill up. I’m so disappointed with this pot! I absolutely loved it , but waking up every morning and having to re brew a pot because it won’t work properly is so aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Crane

customer_reviews.title: Discouraging
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice if it came with everything it needed to work. I guess it's my fault for believing I could by a coffee pot and not have to buy filter assembly separate so couldn't even try it out.
customer_reviews.author: PESA

customer_reviews.title: Great machine but a little messy!
customer_reviews.text: Love that this has both the function to brew a full pot and also make a k-cup single serve in one machine. This replaced two coffee pots because my husband prefers brewed from grounds in a carafe and I like the k-cup convenience and variety. My only disappointment in this machine is the design of the glass carafe. It spills coffee everywhere, no matter how careful you are when you pour it. Literally every single time. It’s definitely frustrating. I hope Keurig will redesign it and offer it for parts replacement. Otherwise love everything about this machine and freeing up the counter space!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought June 12. It is now Aug. 8 and it stopped working right. We have de scaled and did everything ‘support’ said to do. The hot plate is supposed to stay hot for 2 hours?? Not mine! My hot plate has never stayed hot for longer than it takes to brew a full pot. I’m so disappointed and sad. In theory, this is a great idea for a coffee pot; in application it does NOT perform as advertised. Most keurigs we’ve purchased last around 18-24 months. This one didn’t even last 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: My5rule

customer_reviews.title: Dead as a doornail after four months
customer_reviews.text: If I had read the reviews I would have known before buying that the pouring from the carafe without spilling is nearly impossible. (Adjusting to the idiosyncrasies of small appliances is not my forte, but I learned to pour my coffee over the sink.) Pushing the buttons always required a certain "touch" to get the thing to work, but this morning they stopped working altogether. Amazon now shows that the delivery time for a coffee maker is approximately 30 days, but going to the store to buy one during a pandemic seems a bit frivolous... How ever I buy the replacement, it will not be a Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Kenboy

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: I used this coffee maker for less than two months before I started having problems. The single-use servings were inconsistent, and sometimes the 6 oz serving would turn out 8 or more ounces, causing my coffee to overflow! I tried different K-cups, thinking that might be the problem, but it wasn't. The machine was temperamental and even after I followed the trouble-shooting instructions, it wasn't consistent. Sometimes it disbursed the correct amount of coffee, other times it didn't! I want to send it back, but it's passed the return date. Now it sits on my counter taking space.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.text: This is incredibly handy for us who need a quick cup of coffee, or four, without having to grind, measure, add water etc. But we also enjoy big cups of some speciality coffees, especially on weekends and the attached coffeemaker means one machine in the kitchen instead of two. The only thing I would ping this on is the relatively longer amount of time it takes for the K cup to heat up and pour, it was much faster on my standalone Keurig machine. Otherwise it’s a great fit our household.
customer_reviews.author: Concise

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea
customer_reviews.text: From a Keurig lover, this is a great idea providing single serve and multiple cup in one machine! Aesthetically pleasing although, the carafe should be on the right instead of the left. It's good for a lefty, however, the measurements are facing the opposite direction. Certainly not a make or break in my eyes, just a suggestion for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not Good!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. The first time we used it, brand new out of the box, the carafe side wouldn’t produce any of the amounts of coffee selected and kept stopping mid-cycle. We tried every cycle. It is defective and doesn’t suck up enough water to make the amounts needed. Only the single serve side works. Keutig offered to replace it, but it would take several weeks to receive a new one, and who knows if it would work either. My adult daughter told me afterward that they have had to have their Keurig replaced 3 times for this very same reason. Not a good model to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dotty

customer_reviews.title: Carafe and replacement dribbles
customer_reviews.text: Coffee maker is fine the problem is with the carafe. After pouring into a cup, coffee dribbles onto counter. Contacted the company, they admitted they have a problem with this unit and sent a new one. After several uses the carafe also began dribbling. I inspected both pots. It looks like the pot’s lid becomes warped after several heating cycles. I have recontacted the company so far no response.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Stanfiel

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker, but drips while pouring from pot.
customer_reviews.text: I could say I absolutely love this coffee maker if it didn’t drip every single time we poured coffee from the pot. The whole thing works wonderful, looks nice, and we love the duo aspect of it! However, the large pot itself makes the coffee drip down the side of the pot as you pour and makes a mess all over the counter (even though it has the lip). We have been able to use it just holding a towel while we pour, just makes it a little less convenient.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy From Bargain Buddy!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many single cup Keurig’s and thought the one with carafe would be a good replacement for my Cusinart Duo. I liked the design and sleekness but could never get the taste of strong coffee out of the carafe. The vendor I purchased this product from, Bargain Buddy, charged at least 25% more than to purchase in a store. ( I didn’t want to shop at stores) So when I requested a refund I was docked for not having original box (we recycle) and a restocking fee.....long story short I’m out $40. DON’T Buy from Bargain Buddy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Carter

customer_reviews.title: May not last.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this until it just stopped working after 3 weeks. Will exchange and try again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B Haislip

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the idea of having both a regular coffee pot and being able to use a pod at 4 am when I have to get up for work. I spend more time trying to get the power button to turn on than it takes to make the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Keurig coffee make, so I love the coffee. However this coffee maker has the cheapest buttons you can use. They get stuck down, and you can't brew your next coffee with them stuck down. So, you have to mess with them to get them to pop up. I have no confidence that this coffee maker will last a long time, the buttons will one day stick, and refuse to pop us, and that will be that. We have technology for very good buttons. Keurig has cut corners, but not the price. This was NOT cheap to buy, but evidently was cheap to make. Shame on you Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two machines zero coffee
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the shape and footprint of this machine but... Received defective unit the first time (electronics were faulty) and a broken one the second time (shattered water reservoir) so not impressed with the sturdiness. I love my current Keurig 2.0 and it is a solid machine. I want to have a pot and single all in one machine so I guess we will look at a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Student

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second unit and it is definitely NOT worth it. We have had a Keurig for several years and love it, but this set up is definitely flawed. The first unit we got only made one pot of coffee before we got a error code (motor seized). The second one sounds like a a large piece of machinery starting up in my kitchen, which tells me it’s not going to last long. My office bought the same one as well and it last all of 3 weeks. Keurig had a great idea they just didn’t put forth the effort on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kalisa FIsh

customer_reviews.title: Bad Keurig
customer_reviews.text: Had this coffee maker since October 2019. Back in January the descale light came one. We tried numerous times descaling the machine. The light will not go off, but it will still work. This week, the cup size does not work. It will only brew the largest cup. Really disappointed in Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria H

customer_reviews.title: Keurig products are not the same quality, and customer satisfaction has vanished
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I used this coffee maker it leaked. Very disappointed with it. I miss my old Keurig .I tried to get them help me with the problem I'm having with getting my Keurig to brew. Once I followed the customer service rep's suggestions it leaks even more. They will not replace this obviously defective machine. I'm totally disgusted by this companies change of importance from outstanding products and customer satisfaction and loyalty.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: Makes the whole family happy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our whole family loves our keurig k duo coffee maker. We use it everyday, we actually have fun trying all the different flavored coffees, teas and cocoa. The coffee flavor is is amazing. it’s so easy to use and clean. I also like that it has one water tank for both the k cups and the carafe . So glad we purchased and we highly recommend . We also purchased the keurig k cup filter so we can make our favorite coffee from fresh grounds as well. We also use the filter to put tea bags in to make tea . Thanks Keurig and Amazon have a great day:)
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: The brewer is a great concept wrapped in a poor design and even worse quality. The brewer didn't last 2 months before the carafe side stopped working. It will not finish any size brewing cycle on the pot size Also the pot spills coffee everywhere each time you pour a cup. Called kuerig support to report issue and ask for replacement brewer, only to be told they are out of stock and dont have any idea when it will be available. Maybe they have had to replace way too many of these. I'd stay away from this one!
customer_reviews.author: Harold Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Quits working after a short time
customer_reviews.text: I got this in January. I made 1 carafe of coffee and the carafe side stopped working. The K-cup side has now stopped working. Wish I would have read all the reviews before purchasing this. So very disappointed. I use only purified water in it to make sure it doesn’t get build up and stuff from water. Obviously it’s not a water issue. It sounds like it’s pumping water in but nothing is happening and it won’t brew. Don’t waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Dead after three months
customer_reviews.text: The product worked fine until suddenly it wouldn't power on. I tried contacting Amazon and they didn't call and ended my chat.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline L.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this in May 2020 as a Mother's Day gift for my wife, worked great at first, unfortunately it quit working properly by August 2020. It never brews the amount of coffee that you select. I typically make 8 cups and it keeps brewing 2 cups. Now it stopped making the coffee hot, the burner under the pot is not heating. Very frustrating after we have used keurig brand for years without trouble. I think they should stick to making single serve machines because the duo is an epic fail. Also you cant even register the Duo warranty on Keurigs website, they only give the option for their single serve machines. I would definately not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: It said it was a “duo” & said you could use “pods” or your “regular” coffee which was EXTREMELY misleading! On the single cup side you can only use the “pods”! I would have NOT bought it for my daughter if I’d known that! I’m done buying the “Keurig” coffee pots period!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good product, buy reusable coffee filter for best results
customer_reviews.text: The coffee pot is really nice. The only issue I am having at the moment is the fact that regular coffee filters do not work for this coffee pot. Anytime I make coffee with them in the large pot, the ground coffee beans overflow and get everywhere. It is not easy to clean the large coffee area but its pretty easy to clean the kurig single serve part. I bought a reusable coffee filter that is made for this coffee pot on a separate order. I am hoping it helps with the overflowing problem. I do like the coffee maker itself though. It is pretty easy to operate and makes good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Kasha Cushman

customer_reviews.title: Sent product other than described.
customer_reviews.text: Sent product other than described. The description stated that it was programmable and has a strong button for pod option. The older version came with out this option. Ordered twice from amazon and got both old version. I ordered from Kohl's and got the version as described and wanted. This was a switch to an older model not as described. Still waiting for refund after several weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffeemaker on 11/23/2019. As of 2/14/2020 it does not work. It does not even turn on. I loved the coffeemaker when I first got it. I have tried all of the Keurig suggestions to get it to work again but nothing. Worse yet, is this is not the first Keurig I have had fail after a short period of time. Keurig has been totally unresponsive to my requests for help or a replacement. Now I can't find this model on line to buy anywhere. I believe this is my last Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: oboshoe

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it so far
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from my smaller Keurig after several years of use. Most of the time I'm the only coffee drinker in the house and only have one cup a day. But when I have company or need to fill a thermos I wanted the choice without a second machine taking up valuable counter space. This fits the bill perfectly! Easy to use, makes good coffee, I'm happy! Only small complaint is that it says to add water when it looks like there is still some in the tank. Not a big deal though.
customer_reviews.author: Tami L Collins

customer_reviews.title: Pricy with some annoying design issues
customer_reviews.text: A quality product, but lacking options for the cup quantity of brews. On the carafe side the minimum number of cups That can be brewed is 6, resulting in waste if you drink less. On the K-Cup side the there is no way to adjust for a smaller cup, or less water usage than a regular mug, resulting in no ability to brew a stronger coffee, as with other Keurig products. Also pouring from the carafe is nearly impossible to do without dripping due to the design of the spout!
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. White

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Keurig for the last 5 years. We have loved the convenience of kcups. I have started to drink more coffee and hated the thought of using 3 to 4 k-cups a day so we changed to this model. It is so easy for me to make a pot of coffee and my husband makes his 1 k-cup in the morning. I like that I can pull the pot out mid brew and there is no spill. There are multiple settings so I am able to make as much or as little coffee as I want. So far, I have had no problems cleaning it. We are very happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Lisa witmer

customer_reviews.title: There are a Few More steps to Use This Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can make a pot of coffee and when it's finished I can go ahead and make just a Cup of another type Coffee with a pod. It does take three steps to push to get just one cup or a pot of coffee. It does make more noise than I thought it would but it's not terribly bad. Over all I do really like the coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: P Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 1 and it stoped working in 2 months. Amazon exchanged it for a new one and that one stoped working in 3 months. It’s too late to return to Amazon and can’t seem to get in touch with Keurig. Machine stops brewing coffee. If I put 10 cups of water it might brew 4cups then shut off. I have cleaned it and a few times.
customer_reviews.author: angela marano

customer_reviews.title: Want to Love This
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and loved Keurig products in the past and was excited for this two-in-one system and I love the design. For the first 6 weeks it worked great then all of a sudden it stopped brewing full pots of coffee. It didn't matter what amount I chose to brew it would only brew less than 4 cups. The carafe is also impossible to pour without dripping everywhere. I contacted Keurig and they replaced the entire machine for free. I just received it and while the carafe still drips it does brew a full pot of coffee. Hoping it stays consistent.
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: Unable to turn warmer back on
customer_reviews.text: The k-cup portion of the machine pops open when pressing the buttons as many of them are on top. Also I have not been able to turn the warmer back on once the coffee is brewed. Another issue is the only way to set the time is to unplug the machine and plug it back in - then it will let you set the time. Really no impressed with this machine for the large price tag. I would suggest looking at a different model or make.
customer_reviews.author: Chad V.

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: So far I am happy with this purchase. I purchased re-usable (generic brand 2.0 k cups) that work in the machine with no problems. I also bought the water filter device for the water chamber (I'm a little disappointed this piece of plastic did not come with this very expensive machine). The coffee pot does have a warming plate that stays on after the brew is complete. My coffee pot pours perfectly with no spilling. Hopefully this machine will keep working for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Space Saver, clean design and works well.
customer_reviews.text: I like the clean design. Its is easy to use except that if you have a lower hanging wall cabinets it is difficult to see the control panel because it is on the top of the machine and you have to pull it forward to open the filter and pod holder. Also the pouring spout on the coffee craft is poorly designed, you have to pour slow or it will leak over the top and pours erratically. Otherwise it a good machine and we are happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teacher, and I go through a lot of coffee. I was a little anxious after I ordered this and read all the reviews about the carafe spilling/dryopping everywhere when you try to pour, but I haven't had that issue at all; mine pours perfectly. I'm pretty clumsy and my hands shake, but the carafe is well-designed to the point that I actually have to make an effort to spill it. The machine brews coffee quickly, and I love the water reservoir. The strong setting on the k cup side is perfect for me. I haven't tried the auto brew function yet. Pot warmer works very well and keeps the coffee at just the right temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Gryder

customer_reviews.title: Coffee
customer_reviews.text: My gf prefers K cups, while I usually just drink a few cups of regular old Folgers, so this is very convenient for us. Only drawback is it is a little bulky, so check the dimensions if that is a concern to you. Arrived with a broken tank, but I reached out to Keurig directly and they are sending me a new tank free of charge. People really need to stop leaving bad reviews for broken/wrong items.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice coffee pot, no accessories.
customer_reviews.text: Duo is a great coffee 'station". Love the fact I can make a single pod or pot, however, I was very disappointed in paying $160 and receiving no accessories. There was no measuring spoon or sample pack of coffee filters for use with the coffee pot. The day it arrived, my wife was so excited to get it, but had wait until I went to the store to pick up coffee filters. A pack of 100 filter was $2. How much would it cost to include a 6-10 piece stater pack. I expected more with a premium appliance of that price.
customer_reviews.author: B. Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Meh... it’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this product however 2 things could be better. The water receptacle is too small and figuring out which buttons to push are not intuitive. Minor complaint but I don’t understand why there are 4 buttons to push to make a single cup of coffee. I’m keeping it but if I had a choice now I’d just get a high quality kuerig without the pot. I don’t use it as much as I thought I would. Actually not at all.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Anne

customer_reviews.title: If you are mostly going to brew pots of coffee daily do not buy this unit.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. We wait a long time to be able to purchase this coffee maker. The square lip on the pot creates a mess every time you pour a cup. This also leads to coffee on the burner which creates additional mess. The coating on the warmer is now coming off as a result. You're not able to turn on the warmer should the power go off and there is still a pot of coffee. It was way too expensive to have these types of everyday problems.
customer_reviews.author: DeanaJ

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: Love the duality of this machine. I have used keurig for a long time and always loved it. My husband prefers his coffee brewed in a pot and this machine is perfect for the best of both worlds. Clears up a lot of counter space for us. Very easy to use. Looks classy as an appliance. Well worth the money I spent.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Renee

customer_reviews.title: They've changed the carafe. It doesn't drip
customer_reviews.text: As I read reviews, the prevalent complaint was the dripping carafe. I can't get ours to drip even when I try. This is a great machine. It makes a pot or a cup, whatever you want, with an auto feature to brew it when you want. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom W.

customer_reviews.title: Update review!
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker. My husband drinks a pot of coffee daily. I use the single serve side. It is great when you just want one cup. My kids love the single serve side, these use it for hot chocolate. The carafe does drip as others have noted, it is a bit annoying. 3-220 So after using it for two months it has stopped working. It is not worth the money. There are better coffee makers out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Carafe drips and the single cup splashes.
customer_reviews.text: Although I liked the machine and the ease of using it, but had to return it since it was such a hassle to clean up every time I want to pour coffee from the carafe, It drips like no other carafe I used before. Also, when using the single serve, it splashes all around unless you're using togo mug or very tall cup. Call me lazy but for the money I was paying for this machine I expect better!!!
customer_reviews.author: H. Beydoun

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as i expected
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to purchase this! Best of both worlds, right? Well the glass container is horrible to pour. Impossible to pour without making a huge mess. Ive tried pouring it slowly doesn't matter still gets all over counter and mug! Very poor design. Now im having an issue with setting the auto brew. It was working fine for the last 4 months but now it takes anywhere from 3-6 times just trying to set it(not program) but set it the night before. Also when the icon lights up to show its set, my husband mentioned its not brewing automatically in the morning anymore. So annoying! This machine costs to much money to break already!
customer_reviews.author: Maria G

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up. Had my first cup in minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Keurig coffee. This is my 4th one, not that stop working, they pretty much work nonstop. I like this concept of making a pot of coffee or just a cup. This duo was easy to set up. My first cup and pot were perfect. No spills, no leaks. The carafe is spill proof which beats my Mr. Coffee carafe hands down. I hope to get years and years of use out of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Juls B

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.text: We purchased from Amazon because the price was right. Our experience with other Kuerigs over the years made us confidant this was the right one for us and it has been. If there is a down side it's the reservoir is too small if you do a brew and then want a K-cup. Not a big deal but worth pointing out. We have had this for about a month now and it has met our expectations and performed flaulessly.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: 1st off the carafe design is horrible almost always spills, now after about a year of using the kcup side trickles and stops like its clogged although all needles are clean and free if obstruction thats been happening for a month, and yes i clean and descale regularly, today the carafe side after 20 mins no coffee coming out even after removing filter basket and running a cycle with just water. You hear the pump working but water reservoir hasn't dropped although i did eventually get around a half of a teaspoon amount to finally dispense. This is probably the worst keurig I've owned
customer_reviews.author: joel carlotta

customer_reviews.title: Great system
customer_reviews.text: Husband likes pods on way out the door and a full pot on weekend, so this works perfect. Wish could set it to come on and heat for pod side not just timer to brew for pot side. But pods you can walk up to turn on place pod pick brew start and walk away it does it all. Dont have to wait anymore. Much cheaper on here than at website and its the same place.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Wright

customer_reviews.title: Expect better product from keirig
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is another decent brewing system from keirig providing options for single cup or brew a pot options. However, I have issues with getting the coffee filter reservoir back in place. Seriously I have used the “brew pot” function on multiple occasions and each time it takes several minutes to align reservoir so it will slide back into place. That’s just poor design and others who own this product have stated similar issue. Also a larger water reservoir would be nice but that’s not a limiting factor for my 3 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Kcole

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient having both a 12 cup pot and the single k-cup in one unit. I haven’t quite had it a full month yet but there are no complaints, everything works as described and no issues with the unit. The flavor (for me) is a bit weak, I used 4 scoops of fresh ground coffee grinds, maybe it has to get “seasoned” a bit first. Very pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Like A Sieve
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised but I challenge anyone to pour from this pot without leaking all over the countertop. Poor pot design. If you push the top flat of the pot down hard, you reduce spillage. Not thrilled with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Manausa

customer_reviews.title: Great option for either a cup or a pot of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Almost did not buy this because everyone was complaining about the dripping when you pour. We honestly don’t have the issue and this has really worked out well. We were also concerned because they said it was to talk but in my kitchen it works very well with standard height cabinets above them. Only concern is when you turn on the delayed brew option on the pot it heats up the water right then for some reason though it does wait to brew until the programmed time. First few times I was concerned I had not done it right. But it works perfectly. Would recommend this pot for anyone who wants the flexibility this provides.
customer_reviews.author: David Evans

customer_reviews.title: Next level coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is seriously next level! Great design, sleek and modern look, digital screen, easy to use, no dripping when pouring, no leaking, and saving all that counter space! Seriously exceeded my expectations! My family members now are buying it after using mine. I wish I made the switch sooner as I am LOVING the extra counter space using the Duo!
customer_reviews.author: Alysia McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Quick great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Honestly the best part about this coffee machine is if its still making coffee in the pot, you can remove the pot and the machine will momentarily pause as you pour a cup! No more mess when I'm late for classes or work! It's easy to clean, my only gripe is cleaning the k cup section. The k cup section works great however. Con: The motor noise is pretty annoying but I guess its not all that bad. Also, the water reservoir could have been bigger but I usually only have to fill it more than once a day if I have friends or family over. Overall impression: Great buy
customer_reviews.author: Naoufel Farid

customer_reviews.title: coffee delivery system.
customer_reviews.text: After pushing a few buttons it tells you how many Oz of coffee you want. Great! except it does not give you the quantity selected. problem is either program of water pump. Just got it,had a keurig before it lasted over 10 years . Will have to wait until after holidays and then get in touch with amazon or keurig RE: this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pure Joy.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this coffee maker. The size, the speed & the dual options. So glad I gave in & spent the money. No regrets, just pure joy with every cup I make.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Best value for a dual machine.
customer_reviews.text: Had a cheaper dual machine that was difficult to load k cups and the coffee was not hot. This makes a great k cup. Strong setting is indeed strong. We use the drip side daily and the timer is consistent. The carafe does dribble easily when full as other reviews have noted. They should correct that. Pour slowly. The size is a little big on the counter. Makes a good cup of Joe...and hot too.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B. Farlow

customer_reviews.title: Did not get the correct Keurig Duo
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this today and upon opening up the box it was nicely packed in, it was obviously not the right Keurig Duo. The one I received is not the programmable one as there is no clock on the top right side. The word Keurig is on the left side not on the right side as shown in the pictures so back it’s going.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as you think
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first duo but really disappointed. It does not have a timer to set for morning coffee. Also you cannot turn back on the burner to keep coffee warm The plastic is really cheap. Its a Keurig brand; I was expecting A better quality. A Mr Coffee has better quality. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Ok despite a few cons.
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this machine however it is somewhat difficult to run as the buttons are not clear. My house sitter could not figure it out so I will write up instructions to keep nearby. Also the carafe dribbles a fair amount when coffee is poured. Other than that it seems to brew nicely & keep coffee hot and I really like the pod feature.
customer_reviews.author: GES

customer_reviews.title: LOUD!!
customer_reviews.text: I hate to write a bad review on anything Keurig because we love it so much, but this coffee pot is Soooo loud. We've had at least 5 other Keurig machines over the years and this one I was very excited about but couldn't take the noise of it brewing. Switched to the Cuisenart combo brewer and love it! Sorry Keurig you missed the mark on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Kilby

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We've had this coffee maker for only a week but use it every day, sometimes twice or thrice. The Auto function takes a little practice to figure out but works very well. Coffee flavor is great. No spilling of water on the counter - maybe Keurig redesigned the lid or the carafe. Maybe it's all in the technique of pouring. At any rate, we really like this product a lot.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Great dual Coffee Maker, I use it every day.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to the Keurig Line, I use the Pot in the morning, and then my wife and I use the single serve in the evening. Single serve side times out after 5 minutes of non-use, which I wish had an option to select other time intervals. Pot will keep the coffee warm for 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Neis

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my small office. Allows me to make a full pot to put into a pump for customers and I still get my individual cups for me and workers. Before I had 2 coffee makers on my counter. Now I can do it with one. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not my cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This company can be SO MUCH BETTER. While this was NOT the "correct" Keurig - I asked to return it, and how to do it when it was boxed up in a larger box t and left at my front porch. No note, nothing. It took forever to get them to get back to me and help send it back. Now... I had to have my manager physically bring it to a post office on the weekend, because it wasn't picked up as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Sensible Momma

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: I love my Keurig but when we moved the old one had a smell I could not get rid of. I ordered Bunn because the internal workings were steel and not plastic but don't like the way Bunn pots work. I think they would do fine in an office setting but I'm not leaving my coffee pot on all day. When I found this one that does regular coffee in a pot AND the Keurig I had to have it and I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Smith

customer_reviews.title: K-Duo is No Duo
customer_reviews.text: Single cup works fine. The coffee carafe brews at one drip per second. Defeats the purpose of have the Duo in the first place. We didn't try to coffee pot/carafe side until Feb., and we were outside of our return window at that time. Tough to believe this is what you get when you pay the price of a Keurig!
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Lundquist

customer_reviews.title: Love the size and the ease of making just one cup.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly under the cabinet. Glad this one had a timer. The only thing it doesn’t do, is when it turns off, the heating element won’t stay on long if you turn it back on. Takes me awhile to drink my coffee and two hours it turns off . Don’t want to make another pot...
customer_reviews.author: catchin

customer_reviews.title: Great coffeemaker!
customer_reviews.text: I like the versatility of this model. I also like the options for the number of ounces I can brew or a whole carafe! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Eva DeShay

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Cup!
customer_reviews.text: Mom approved! Bought this a birthday gift for my mother in-law and she absolutely. Very easy set up. Works outstandingly. Love the combo and surprisingly, it doesn’t take up to much space. Nicely done!
customer_reviews.author: John “Mr. So ExQuiiSiiTe” Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Coffee when and how I want.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gift I have received in years. I love having the option of a single cup or brewing a pot. It is so easy to use and clean. I can have any type/flavor whenever i want. It also makes hot chocolate and hot tea from pods. Yes in case you can't tell I absolutely recomend this Kuerig.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Just what our home needed!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a daily coffee drinker, my husband isn't. This coffee brewer allows us to brew a pot whenever we both crave a cup or have guests yet gives the option for a single serving with a K-cup. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Hartley

customer_reviews.title: stops working
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th keurig duo I've had. Sent each of the others back and was replaced. Same exact thing happens with every machine. After a couple months I try to use vinegar as instructed to clean and it will not 'brew' cycle through the clean cycle. Then it will not make coffee (maybe 1/2 inch only). I'm so frustrated I will not get on the phone again and send back the machine. I'm just DONE. Into the garbage goes over $100.
customer_reviews.author: M. Henderson

product_meta.title: Keurig K-Duo Coffee Maker, Single Serve and 12-Cup Carafe Drip Coffee Brewer, Compatible with K-Cup Pods and Ground Coffee, Black
product_meta.description: Style Name:K-DuoIntroducing the K-Duo Single Serve and Carafe Coffee Maker: the perfect brewer for any occasion. This versatile brewer is the best of both worlds, using both K-Cup pods and ground coffee to brew a cup and a carafe of your favorite varieties. The included 12-cup glass carafe and heating plate are perfect for keeping your coffee hot, and the added convenience of the Pause and Pour feature makes serving a snap! No need to wait for the entire carafe to brew – the Keurig K-Duo coffee maker can be paused mid-brew for 20 seconds, so you can pour fresh, hot coffee right away. Or set your preferred brew time up to 24 hours in advance and enjoy a freshly brewed carafe right when you want it with Programmable Carafe Auto Brew. Create your perfect cup and carafe every time with the K-Duo coffee maker. Choose your favorite ground coffee, or choose from hundreds of delicious K-Cup pod varieties of coffee, tea, cocoa, and more. Use the Strong Brew button for a bolder, more intense single cup. With multiple brew sizes, you can make a 6, 8, 10, or 12-cup carafe for large gatherings, as well as a 6, 8, 10, or 12 oz. cup just for you. You can brew the perfect amount of fresh, full-flavored coffee whether you’re hosting friends or just enjoying a cup – and a moment – to yourself!
feature_bullets: What’s in the box: 12-cup glass carafe included with your brewer along with a heating plate to keep coffee hot.
Brew a cup and a carafe: Use both ground coffee and k-cup pods.
Multiple brew sizes: Brew a 6, 8, 10, or 12-cup carafe and a 6, 8, 10, or 12 ounce cup.
Compatible with keurig gold tone mesh filter accessory: A reusable coffee filter you can use to brew your perfect carafe (sold separately).

Large 60 ounce water reservoir: The 60 ounce water reservoir is shared between the single serve and carafe brewing, saving you time and simplifying your morning routine. Removable reservoir makes refilling easy.
Strong brew: Brew a stronger, more intense single cup. 30 inch cord length
Programmable carafe auto-brew: Program your coffee maker to automatically brew a carafe upto 24 hours in advance.
Pause & pour: Automatically pauses your Coffee maker mid brew for 20 seconds, allowing the carafe to be poured

Smart start: Your Coffee maker heats, then brews in1 simple process. No need to wait for it to heat before selecting your cup size. Height with handle open-17.63 H inch. Height with drip cover open-18 H inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,746 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
